TopicTitle: Is there a landing indicator mod?

Articles.Content:
Is there a landing indicator mod? I'm looking for something like MechJeb's blue crosshair that shows where you'll land when on a reentry trajectory.

Thanks

Well, there's a mod which I unfortunately cannot remember the name of that incorporates atmospheres into the normal trajectory prediction, but it doesn't account for things like the rotation of the planet under you, or lift-generating surfaces on your craft.

EDIT: Well, I'm just a gibbon. It turns out the Trajectories mod WAS the one I was referring to, but I had only seen a few very brief videos of the mod on YouTube and wasn't aware it was so full-featured.

Edited October 26, 2014 by zxczxczbfg

You might look at Trajectories: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93685

EDIT: this is not the mod zxczxczbfg was talking about; it does account for (FAR) lift, and the planetary rotation feature is very useful on airless worlds.
Thanks guys. That's exactly what I'm looking for and more.

I have Trajectories and Engineer Redux and on Redux, they tell you what biome you'll impact and an estimated time of landing. Of course, they aren't too accurate if you use realism mods that affect atmosphere
